    All Known Implementing Classes:

    Replaced by AsyncWriteTransaction

extends DataChange<P,D>, DataReader<P,D>

      • getIdentifier

        java.lang.Object getIdentifier()

        Transaction identifier

      • getStatus

        TransactionStatus getStatus()
        Deprecated. 

      • putOperationalData

        void putOperationalData(P path,
                      D data)
        Deprecated. 
        Store a piece of data at specified path. This acts as a merge operation, which is to say that any pre-existing data which is not explicitly overwritten will be preserved. This means that if you store a container, its child lists will be merged. Performing the following put operations: 1) container { list [ a ] } 2) container { list [ b ] } will result in the following data being present: container { list [ a, b ] } This also means that storing the container will preserve any augmentations which have been attached to it. If you require an explicit replace operation, perform removeOperationalData first.

      • putConfigurationData

        void putConfigurationData(P path,
                        D data)
        Deprecated. 
        Store a piece of data at specified path. This acts as a merge operation, which is to say that any pre-existing data which is not explicitly overwritten will be preserved. This means that if you store a container, its child lists will be merged. Performing the following put operations: 1) container { list [ a ] } 2) container { list [ b ] } will result in the following data being present: container { list [ a, b ] } This also means that storing the container will preserve any augmentations which have been attached to it. If you require an explicit replace operation, perform removeConfigurationData first.

      • commit

        java.util.concurrent.Future<org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.common.RpcResult<TransactionStatus>> commit()
        Deprecated. 
        Initiates a two-phase commit of modification.

        The successful commit changes the state of the system and may affect several components.

        The effects of successful commit of data are described in the specifications and YANG models describing the Provider components of controller. It is assumed that Consumer has an understanding of this changes.

        Parameters:
        store - Identifier of the store, where commit should occur.
        Returns:
        Result of the Commit, containing success information or list of encountered errors, if commit was not successful. The Future blocks until TransactionStatus.COMMITED or TransactionStatus.FAILED is reached.
        See Also:
        for further information how two-phase commit is processed.
